concise_definition: v. 生存, 挺过, 幸存

definitions.explanation_en: To remain alive after an event or condition that has killed or threatened to kill others, often under extreme or dangerous circumstances.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在导致他人死亡或构成严重威胁的事件或状况后仍能活下来，通常发生在极端或危险的环境中。
definitions.example_en: Only a few people survived the earthquake that destroyed the entire village.
definitions.example_cn: 只有少数人在摧毁整个村庄的地震中幸存下来。

definitions.explanation_en: To continue to exist or function despite difficulties, decline, or changing conditions, often implying resilience or endurance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在困难、衰退或环境变化中仍能持续存在或运作，通常暗示韧性或持久力。
definitions.example_en: Despite economic hardship, the family business has survived for three generations.
definitions.example_cn: 尽管经济困难，这家家族企业已延续了三代。

definitions.explanation_en: To outlive someone or something, especially in the context of death or obsolescence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指比某人或某物活得更久，尤其在死亡或过时的语境中。
definitions.example_en: She survived her husband by ten years and continued to live independently.
definitions.example_cn: 她比丈夫多活了十年，并一直独立生活。

comparison.analysis: “Live” (生活/活着) 是一个更广泛、更中性的词，泛指拥有生命或进行日常活动，不强调对抗危险或逆境。而 “survive” 特指在威胁生命的环境中坚持下来，带有强烈的“克服危机”含义。
“Endure” (忍受/经受) 强调在痛苦、困难或压力下持续承受，常用于描述心理或身体上的忍耐，如忍受疼痛或恶劣条件。而 “survive” 更侧重于结果——最终活下来或未被摧毁，不一定强调过程的痛苦。
“Persist” (坚持/持续) 指持续做某事，即使遇到阻碍，常用于行为、努力或状态的延续，如“persist in studying”。而 “survive” 通常用于生命、组织或事物在毁灭性力量下的存续，语义重心在“避免消亡”。
